definition: hangul, Korean phonetic alphabet/Korean written language
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han

sentences.english: But they don't need to import the Hangul characters.
sentences.chinese: 但他们无须进口这些韩文字母。

sentences.english: Whether to enable to change the input mode between hangul and ascii mode.
sentences.chinese: 是否允许在韩文和英文模式间转换。
尼娜说，“确切地说，是北朝鲜使用的韩文。”

sentences.english: First, congratulations on the opening of the 'Hangeul Library.
sentences.chinese: 首先，祝贺‘韩文图书馆’开张。

sentences.english: Foreign country fans are learning Korean in order to message me.
sentences.chinese: 外国的影迷为了与我通讯都在学习韩文。

sentences.english: TwinBridge products include enabling systems for Chinese, Japanese and Korean, OCR and much more.
sentences.chinese: 双桥产品包括中，日，韩文系统，光学字元辨识，等。

definition: Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)
Korean text HunMin JongUm promulgated by Sejong Daewang in 1418 to introduce hangeul
